page.title: 09A RIVERSIDE PUB, LITTLEPORT
page.content: We know that the pub goes back at least to the 1800s but probably much further.It was called the{Black Horse because horses, which pulled the {barges}and{lighters}along the River Ouse between Bedford, Cambridge and the port at Kings Lynn, were kept there. One man has been daily to the pub for 24 years. The present owner took over the pub 9 years ago.He said that if he didn't own the pub he go back to the building trade. When he retires he would rather a stranger took over the pub. The pub has been modernised recently, a{restaurant}added and tables set next to a quay. When the{fishing}season is good there are a lot of customers, including foreign customers such as Germans, Italians, French, Americans, Greeks, Danish etc.
